verses.plain: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.

tokens.t: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.

verses.plain: The LORD hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.

tokens.t: The
hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.

verses.plain: ¶ He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God:

tokens.t: ¶ He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God:

verses.plain: Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him in Beth-el, and there he spake with us;

tokens.t: Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him
Beth-el, and there he spake with us;

verses.plain: Even the LORD God of hosts; the LORD is his memorial.

tokens.t: Even the
God of hosts; the
his memorial.

verses.plain: Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.

tokens.t: Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.

verses.plain: ¶ He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress.

tokens.t: a merchant, the balances of deceit
in his hand: he loveth to oppress.

verses.plain: And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that were sin.

tokens.t: And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance:
all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that
sin.

verses.plain: And I that am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.

tokens.t: And I
the
thy God from the land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.

verses.plain: I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets.

tokens.t: I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets.

verses.plain: Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.

tokens.t: iniquity
Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars
as heaps in the furrows of the fields.

verses.plain: And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.

tokens.t: And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept

verses.plain: And by a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.

tokens.t: And by a prophet the
brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.

verses.plain: Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.

tokens.t: Ephraim provoked
to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.

footnotes.text: had…: Heb. was a prince, or, behaved himself princely
in all…: or, all my labours suffice me not: he shall have punishment of iniquity in whom is sin
